recipes.name: Savory Chicken Salad with Fresh Green Beans
recipes.description: A refreshing savory chicken salad with crisp green beans and tangy dressing — great for light lunches or dinners.

steps.instruction: Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper. Pan-sear over medium heat until cooked through. Let rest and slice.
Blanch green beans in boiling water for 2–3 minutes; plunge into ice water to keep them crisp.
In a large bowl, combine lettuce, cucumber, tomatoes, green beans, and sliced chicken.
Drizzle banana dressing over the salad and toss gently to coat everything evenly.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Chill salad for 10 minutes before serving.
Serve chilled or at room temperature. Garnish with fresh herbs if desired.

recipes.name: Creamy Tomato Basil Pasta
recipes.description: Warm pasta in a creamy tomato basil sauce — comfort food for any day of the week.

steps.instruction: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a pan, sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add tomato sauce and simmer 5 minutes, then stir in heavy cream.
Add cooked pasta to the sauce and toss to coat.
Stir in fresh basil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with grated cheese or extra basil if desired.

recipes.name: Garlic Lemon Roasted Salmon
recipes.description: Tender salmon fillets roasted with garlic and lemon — simple, healthy, and elegant.

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with foil.
Place salmon fillets on the sheet, drizzle with olive oil, garlic, lemon juice and zest.
Season with salt and pepper.
Roast in preheated oven for 15–18 minutes until salmon is cooked through.
Remove from oven, sprinkle with fresh parsley.
Serve hot with a side salad or veggies.

recipes.name: Spicy Chickpea Buddha Bowl
recipes.description: A nourishing buddha bowl loaded with protein-rich chickpeas and colorful veggies with a spicy dressing kick.

steps.instruction: Cook quinoa per package instructions and set aside to cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, quinoa, spinach, bell pepper, and avocado.
Drizzle spicy tahini dressing over the bowl and toss gently.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with fresh cilantro or parsley if desired.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for later (up to 2 days).

recipes.name: Herbed Mushroom Risotto
recipes.description: Creamy mushroom risotto with fresh herbs — a cozy and earthy dish for dinner nights.

steps.instruction: Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until translucent.
Add mushrooms and cook until soft.
Stir in arborio rice and toast for 1–2 minutes.
Gradually add warmed broth, one ladle at a time, stirring continuously until liquid is absorbed before adding next.
Continue until rice is creamy and al dente (about 20 minutes).
Stir in fresh parsley, season with salt and pepper, and serve warm.

recipes.name: Quinoa Black Bean Salad
recipes.description: A protein-packed quinoa and black bean salad with fresh veggies — perfect for meal prep or a healthy lunch.

steps.instruction: Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Let cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, corn, red bell pepper, red onion, and cilantro.
For dressing: whisk olive oil, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss.
Taste and adjust seasoning before serving.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
recipes.description: A classic Italian pasta with garlic, olive oil and red pepper flakes — quick to make and full of flavor.

steps.instruction: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente. Drain, reserving some pasta water.
In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes, sauté until garlic is golden.
Add drained pasta to the pan. Toss rapidly to coat with oil and garlic.
If dry, add a splash of reserved pasta water to loosen.
Stir in chopped parsley and season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, topped with parmesan if desired.

recipes.name: Banana Oatmeal Breakfast Bowl
recipes.description: A warm, hearty oatmeal bowl with banana — a perfect start to your day.

steps.instruction: Combine oats and milk in a pot. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally until thickened.
Once creamy, remove from heat and let sit 1 minute.
Stir in sliced banana, honey, and cinnamon.
Pour into bowls, top with chopped walnuts.
Serve warm.
Store leftovers in the fridge and reheat with a splash of milk.

recipes.name: Vegetable Stir-Fry with Tofu
recipes.description: A quick and colorful veggie stir-fry with tofu — healthy, tasty and ready in under 20 minutes.

steps.instruction: Heat sesame oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
Add tofu cubes, stir-fry until slightly golden. Remove and set aside.
In same pan, add broccoli, carrot, and bell pepper — stir-fry 5–6 minutes until veggies are tender-crisp.
Return tofu to the pan. Add soy sauce and toss to coat evenly.
Stir everything together for another minute.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

recipes.name: Blueberry Banana Smoothie
recipes.description: A refreshing blueberry banana smoothie — creamy, fruity and perfect for breakfast or a snack.

steps.instruction: Add all ingredients to a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Check consistency — add more plant milk if too thick.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.
Optional: top with extra blueberries or chia seeds.
Consume right away for best freshness.

recipes.name: Grilled Vegetable Quinoa Bowl
recipes.description: A bowl of grilled veggies over fluffy quinoa — healthy, filling and great for lunch or dinner.

steps.instruction: Cook quinoa as per instructions and fluff with a fork.
Toss zucchini, eggplant, and bell pepper with olive oil, salt and pepper.
Grill or roast vegetables until tender and slightly charred.
In bowls, layer quinoa and top with grilled veggies.
Drizzle lemon vinaigrette over bowl and toss gently.
Serve warm or chilled.

recipes.name: Chocolate Banana Protein Smoothie
recipes.description: A rich and creamy chocolate banana smoothie — perfect after workouts or as a healthy treat.

steps.instruction: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Adjust thickness with more milk if needed.
Pour into glasses and enjoy.
Optional: garnish with banana slices or cocoa nibs.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Turkey Avocado Wrap
recipes.description: A quick, satisfying turkey and avocado wrap — perfect for lunch on the go.

ingredients.name: sliced turkey breast
ingredients.notes: deli style or leftover cooked turkey

steps.instruction: Lay out the tortillas and spread mayo or preferred spread evenly.
Layer lettuce, sliced turkey, avocado, and tomato on each tortilla.
Season with salt and pepper if desired.
Fold the tortillas into wraps tightly.
Slice in half and serve immediately or wrap for later.
Store in fridge if not eating right away (best within 24 hours).

recipes.name: Greek Chickpea Salad
recipes.description: A Mediterranean-style chickpea salad with fresh veggies and herbs — light, nutritious and delicious.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, and parsley.
Pour vinaigrette dressing over the mixture and toss well.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Let sit 5 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
Store leftovers in fridge (up to 2 days).

recipes.name: Classic Pancakes with Maple Syrup
recipes.description: Fluffy pancakes drizzled with maple syrup — a perfect weekend breakfast treat.

steps.instruction: In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk milk, egg, and melted butter.
Combine wet and dry ingredients; stir until just blended — small lumps are fine.
Heat a nonstick pan over medium heat, melt a little butter.
Pour batter for each pancake; cook 2–3 minutes per side until golden brown.
Stack pancakes and serve with maple syrup and butter.

recipes.name: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
recipes.description: Classic beef and broccoli stir-fry — tender beef strips and crisp broccoli in savory sauce, ready fast.

steps.instruction: Mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cornstarch in a bowl; set aside as sauce.
Heat sesame oil in a wok over high heat. Add beef strips and stir-fry until browned. Remove and set aside.
Add broccoli to wok, stir-fry 4–5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Return beef to wok, pour in sauce and toss until everything is coated and sauce thickens.
Cook for another minute, then turn off heat.
Serve hot over steamed rice.

recipes.name: Lemon Garlic Chicken with Roasted Potatoes
recipes.description: Juicy chicken thighs baked with lemon and garlic, served with crispy roasted potatoes — a hearty, comforting meal.

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Toss potato wedges with half the olive oil, salt, pepper, and half the garlic.
Place potatoes on a baking tray and start roasting.
Meanwhile, rub chicken thighs with remaining olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
After potatoes roast 15 minutes, add chicken thighs to the tray.
Roast another 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked and potatoes are crispy.
Let rest 5 minutes before serving. Serve with a side salad if desired.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Tacos with Black Beans
recipes.description: Quick vegetarian tacos loaded with black beans, veggies and spicy salsa — perfect for taco night.

steps.instruction: Warm tortillas in a skillet or oven.
In a pan, sauté bell pepper and red onion until softened.
Add black beans, cook until heated through.
Season with salt, pepper, and optional spices (chili powder, cumin).
Assemble tacos: add bean mixture, salsa, and avocado slices to each tortilla.
Serve immediately with lime wedges if available.

recipes.name: Apple Cinnamon Baked Oatmeal
recipes.description: Warm baked oatmeal with apples and cinnamon — a cozy breakfast or brunch idea.

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a baking dish.
In a bowl, combine oats, chopped apples, cinnamon, and walnuts.
Pour milk and maple syrup over oat mixture; stir to combine.
Transfer to the baking dish and bake 25–30 minutes until top is golden and set.
Remove from oven and let rest 5 minutes.
Serve warm with extra maple syrup or yogurt.

recipes.name: Shrimp and Avocado Salad
recipes.description: Light and fresh shrimp and avocado salad — perfect for a quick lunch or light dinner.

steps.instruction: Boil or sauté shrimp until cooked through (about 3–4 minutes). Cool slightly.
In a bowl, combine mixed greens, tomatoes, avocado and shrimp.
Whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper for dressing.
Drizzle dressing over salad and toss gently.
Adjust seasoning to taste.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Banana Chia Pudding
recipes.description: Creamy banana chia pudding — a healthy and quick dessert or breakfast option.

steps.instruction: In a bowl or jar, mash banana until smooth.
Add chia seeds, plant milk, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Stir well to combine, cover, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Before serving, stir pudding. If too thick, add a splash of milk.
Top with fresh berries if using.
Serve chilled.

recipes.name: Thai Green Curry with Vegetables
recipes.description: A fragrant, creamy Thai green curry loaded with fresh vegetables — great for a cozy dinner.

steps.instruction: In a pot, heat a little oil and sauté green curry paste for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add all chopped vegetables. Simmer 10–12 minutes until tender but still crisp.
Stir in basil leaves. Season with salt or soy sauce if needed.
Serve hot over steamed rice or quinoa.
Garnish with extra basil or lime wedges if desired.

recipes.name: Garlic Butter Shrimp Pasta
recipes.description: Succulent shrimp tossed in garlic-butter sauce over pasta — rich, satisfying and quick to make.

steps.instruction: Cook spaghetti until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté briefly.
Add shrimp and cook until pink and cooked through (about 3–4 minutes).
Add cooked pasta to the pan, toss with shrimp and butter-garlic sauce.
Stir in parsley and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with extra parsley or lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup
recipes.description: Creamy roasted butternut squash soup — warm, comforting and loaded with fall flavors.

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Toss squash cubes with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt and pepper and roast 25 minutes until tender.
In a pot, sauté onion with remaining olive oil until soft.
Add roasted squash and vegetable broth to pot; bring to a boil then simmer 10 minutes.
Blend soup until smooth (use immersion blender or regular blender).
Stir in coconut milk if using, add nutmeg, and adjust salt/pepper.
Serve hot with crusty bread or garnish of your choice.

recipes.name: Vegetable Fried Rice
recipes.description: Quick vegetable fried rice — a great way to use leftover rice and make a wholesome meal in minutes.

steps.instruction: Heat sesame oil in a large pan or wok over high heat. Add garlic and stir briefly.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry 2–3 minutes.
Add cold rice and soy sauce; stir to combine and heat through.
Break up any rice clumps and toss thoroughly.
Stir in chopped green onions. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Serve hot; optionally top with sesame seeds.

recipes.name: Classic Caesar Salad
recipes.description: A timeless Caesar salad with crisp romaine, tangy dressing and crunchy croutons — simple and refreshing.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine, croutons, and grated parmesan.
Pour Caesar dressing over salad, toss gently to coat.
Add lemon juice and black pepper if desired.
Taste and adjust seasoning.
Serve immediately.
Best eaten fresh — croutons stay crunchy.

recipes.name: Pumpkin Spice Muffins
recipes.description: Soft pumpkin spice muffins with warm autumn flavors — great for breakfast or dessert.

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease or line a muffin tin.
In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, and cinnamon.
In another bowl, mix pumpkin puree, milk, and sugar.
Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed.
Divide batter into muffin cups.
Bake 18–20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool before serving.

recipes.name: Black Bean & Sweet Potato Chili
recipes.description: Hearty black bean and sweet potato chili — warm, filling and perfect for chilly evenings.

steps.instruction: In a pot, sauté onion until soft.
Add sweet potato cubes, tomato sauce, vegetable broth, and chili powder.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes or until sweet potato is tender.
Add black beans and simmer another 5 minutes.
Stir, taste for seasoning, adjust salt/pepper or spices.
Serve hot, optionally with toppings like avocado, cilantro or tortilla chips.

recipes.name: Strawberry Spinach Salad with Feta
recipes.description: A bright, fresh strawberry and spinach salad with creamy feta — ideal for spring or summer meals.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, combine spinach, sliced strawberries, red onion, and almonds if using.
Drizzle balsamic vinaigrette over the salad.
Toss gently to coat ingredients evenly.
Sprinkle crumbled feta on top.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.description: Soft and chewy peanut butter cookies with chocolate chips — a crowd-pleasing classic treat.

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a bowl, mix peanut butter and sugar until smooth.
Add egg, vanilla extract, and baking soda. Mix well.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Scoop small balls of dough onto baking sheet, flatten slightly.
Bake 10–12 minutes until edges are golden. Let cool before serving.

recipes.name: One-Pot Chicken and Rice
recipes.description: Complete meal cooked in one pot with chicken, rice, and vegetables - minimal cleanup required!

steps.instruction: Season chicken with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
In a large pot, brown chicken on both sides, then remove.
Add onion to the same pot, cook until softened.
Add rice, broth, and vegetables. Return chicken to pot.
Bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer covered for 20-25 minutes.
Let rest 5 minutes before serving. Everything in one pot!

recipes.name: One-Pot Pasta Primavera
recipes.description: Fresh vegetables and pasta cooked together in one pot with creamy sauce - easy cleanup!

steps.instruction: In a large pot, combine pasta, broth, and all vegetables.
Bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer 10-15 minutes until pasta is tender.
Stir in cream and season with salt and pepper.
Cook 2 more minutes until sauce thickens slightly.
Garnish with fresh herbs if desired.
Serve hot directly from the pot!

recipes.name: Protein-Packed Quinoa Bowl
recipes.description: High-protein bowl with quinoa, chickpeas, and Greek yogurt - perfect for post-workout fuel!

steps.instruction: Cook quinoa according to package directions.
In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, chickpeas, and spinach.
Top with Greek yogurt and sprinkle with hemp seeds.
Add sliced almonds for extra protein and crunch.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Mix everything together and enjoy your protein boost!

recipes.name: High-Protein Lentil Curry
recipes.description: Protein-rich red lentil curry with aromatic spices - filling and nutritious!

steps.instruction: In a large pot, sauté onion until softened.
Add curry powder and turmeric, cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Add lentils, coconut milk, and broth. Bring to boil.
Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve over rice with fresh cilantro. High in plant protein!

recipes.name: Budget-Friendly Rice and Beans
recipes.description: Hearty and affordable rice and beans with simple seasonings - feeds a crowd for less!

steps.instruction: In a large pot, sauté onion until softened.
Add rice, beans, broth, cumin, and garlic powder.
Bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer covered 18 minutes.
Let stand 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot. Costs under $5 to feed 6 people!

recipes.name: Budget Egg Fried Rice
recipes.description: Simple and cheap fried rice with eggs - uses pantry staples and leftover rice!

steps.instruction: Heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
Add beaten eggs and scramble until just set.
Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Add rice and soy sauce, stir-fry for 5 minutes.
Stir in green onions and cook 1 more minute.
Serve hot. Perfect use for leftover rice and costs under $3!

recipes.name: One-Pot Hearty Beef Stew
recipes.description: Classic beef stew with vegetables, all cooked in one pot - perfect comfort food with easy cleanup!

steps.instruction: In a large pot, brown beef chunks on all sides.
Add onion and cook until softened.
Stir in tomato paste and cook 1 minute.
Add broth, potatoes, and carrots. Bring to boil.
Reduce heat, cover and simmer 1.5 hours until beef is tender.
Season and serve hot. One pot = one cleanup!

recipes.name: Protein Power Smoothie Bowl
recipes.description: High-protein smoothie bowl with Greek yogurt, protein powder, and nutritious toppings!

steps.instruction: Blend yogurt, protein powder, banana, and 1 tbsp peanut butter until smooth.
Pour into a bowl.
Top with remaining peanut butter, chia seeds, and granola.
Add fresh berries if desired.
Enjoy immediately for maximum protein boost!
Contains 30+ grams of protein per serving!
